p: Bartonella henselae infection, as in “cat scratch disease,” is associated with hepatosplenic necrotizing granulomas. Peliosis hepatis or blood-filled cysts are seen in infections in patients with concomitant AIDS. A papular dermatitis and pulmonary and neurological symptoms may also occur. The bacillary angiomatosis is treated with erythromycin, while doxycycline may be considered for treatment of visceral disease [ 21].
